context:
Building a modern e-commerce platform for small-to-medium businesses. Key features: product catalog, shopping cart, checkout with Stripe, user accounts, order management, inventory tracking, and admin dashboard. Target: 10K concurrent users, mobile-first responsive design.

**CRITICAL TECH STACK (DO NOT SUBSTITUTE):**
- Frontend: React.js SPA (NOT Next.js), Redux Toolkit for state, Styled Components for styling
- Backend: Go with Gin framework
- Cloud: Azure (AKS, Azure SQL, Blob Storage, CDN)

interviewAnswers.problem: SMBs struggle with expensive, complex e-commerce platforms. Shopify is costly, WooCommerce requires PHP expertise. We need a modern, scalable, cost-effective solution.
interviewAnswers.targetUser: Small-to-medium business owners selling physical/digital products online. Non-technical users who need simple admin UI, developers who need API access.
interviewAnswers.successMetrics: 1000 active stores in 6 months, 99.9% uptime, checkout conversion >3%, page load <2s, cart abandonment <60%
interviewAnswers.mvpScope: Phase 1: Product catalog, cart, Stripe checkout, user auth, order history. Phase 2: Inventory, coupons, analytics. Phase 3: Multi-vendor, subscriptions.
interviewAnswers.businessContext: Seed-funded startup, $150K runway. Team: 2 Backend (Go), 2 Frontend (React), 1 DevOps. Timeline: MVP in 12 weeks.
interviewAnswers.architecture: Monorepo with separate frontend/backend. Frontend: React SPA with Vite. Backend: Go microservices (Gin). Database: Azure SQL. Cache: Redis. Queue: Azure Service Bus. Storage: Azure Blob. CDN: Azure CDN.
interviewAnswers.security: OAuth 2.0 + JWT. PCI-DSS compliance for payments (Stripe handles card data). HTTPS everywhere. Input validation. SQL injection prevention. Rate limiting. CORS policy.
interviewAnswers.scale: Start: single AKS cluster. Scale: horizontal pod autoscaling, read replicas, CDN for static assets. Target: 10K concurrent users, 1M products.
interviewAnswers.stateManagement: Redux Toolkit with RTK Query for API calls. Slice per domain: cart, products, user, orders. Persist cart to localStorage.
interviewAnswers.styling: Styled Components with theme provider. Design tokens for colors, spacing, typography. Mobile-first responsive breakpoints.
interviewAnswers.renderingStrategy: React SPA with client-side rendering. Vite for bundling. Code splitting by route. Lazy load product images.
interviewAnswers.testing: Jest + React Testing Library for frontend. Go testing package for backend. Playwright for E2E. Target: 80% coverage.
interviewAnswers.definitionOfDone:
- Code reviewed and merged
- Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- E2E tests passing
- No ESLint/Go lint errors
- Deployed to staging
- QA sign-off
- Performance budget met (<2s LCP)

author: ShopFlow Engineering
